column4: a quick question, i am experimenting with compiling a kernel from scratch and i have been getting kernel panics after i boot. I do not use any ram disks while booting, should i?
kernel panics when trying to work with filesystems
if you don't use an initrd you need to make sure everything required to mount your root fs is builtin, not a module
if your root device is sda1 make sure you have scsi support, scsi disk support etc. builtin too
